thing-type.label: CT200X Vivint Element Thermostat w/ other sensors
thing-type.description: Vivint Element Thermostat w/ other sensors<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gtThis thermostat is provided by Vivint, but can join a non-Vivint ZWave network.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtInclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtThe Vivint Element Thermostat is a Z-Wave® compliant thermostat. It has an onboard radio that can be added to an existing Z-Wave® network. This device can be used on a network with products from different vendors.</p&gt <ol&gt<li&gtSet your primary controller to INCLUDE mode to add the thermostat as a node on your network (see your specific controller’s User Manual for detailed instructions).</li&gt <li&gtThe Thermostat main screen shows a welcome message. Press the SIDE button to continue.</li&gt <li&gtPress the SIDE button to initiate the inclusion process. This initiates the network connection process. <ul&gt<li&gtIf inclusion fails, the screen says “Failed”. Press the SIDE button to try adding again.</li&gt </ul&gt</li&gt <li&gtWhen the Thermostat has been successfully included to a Z-Wave network, the screen displays a confirmation check mark. Press the SIDE button to continue. You can now configure the thermostat to work with your HVAC system.</li&gt <li&gtYour primary controller indicates that the thermostat was successfully added to its network (see your specific controller’s User Manual for details).</li&gt </ol&gt<br /&gt<h2&gtExclusion Information</h2&gt<p&gtThe Vivint Element can be excluded from the Z-Wave network process similar to the inclusion process. Set your primary controller to EXCLUDE.</p&gt <br /&gt<h2&gtWakeup Information</h2&gt<p&gtWhen your thermostat is running on battery power, the Z-Wave radio will turn off to help conserve battery life. The Thermostat Z-Wave radio module supports Z-Wave beaming, which allows other devices in the network to wake up the Z-Wave module and accept commands and then go back to sleep.</p&gt <p&gtWhen your thermostat is running on C-Wire power, the Z-Wave radio will stay on and actively help route messages within the Z-Wave network. The thermostat’s node type is fixed when it is included to the Z-Wave network; if the C-Wire is present and powered when including to the network, the thermostat will remain an alwayslistening node until it is removed from the network.</p&gt

parameter.name: config_1_1_wo
parameter.label: 1: Temperature Reporting Threshold (8-bit)
parameter.description: This value determines the reporting threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis value determines the reporting threshold when association reporting is enabled.<br /&gtUnsupported values are ignored.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_2_4
parameter.label: 2: HVAC Settings
parameter.description: Retrieves the HVAC Settings<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtByte 1 = HVAC Setup: Normal (0x01) or Heat Pump (0x02)</p&gt <p&gtByte 2 = Aux Setup (Gas (0x01) or Electric (0x02)) &amp; Number of Auxiliary Stages (Heat Pump)/Number of Heat Stages (Normal)</p&gt <p&gtByte 3 = Number of Heat Pump Stages</p&gt <p&gtByte 4 = Number of Cool Stages</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_3_1_wo
parameter.label: 3: Utility Lock
parameter.description: Enable or Disable the Utility Lock<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf set to 0, the utility lock is disabled. All other values (1-255) enable the utility lock.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_4_1
parameter.label: 4: C-Wire/Battery Status
parameter.description: Query power which source is in use<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf 0x01, the thermostat is powered by a C-wire.</p&gt <p&gtIf 0x02, the thermostat is powered by batteries.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_5_1
parameter.label: 5: Humidity Reporting Threshold
parameter.description: This value determines the reporting threshold<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis value determines the reporting threshold when association reporting is enabled. Unsupported values are ignored.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_6_1
parameter.label: 6: Auxiliary/Emergency
parameter.description: Auxiliary / Emergency Heat Pump Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf set to 0, auxiliary / emergency heat is disabled.</p&gt <p&gtAll other values (1-255) enable auxiliary / emergency heat.</p&gt <p&gtThis can only be enabled when the thermostat is set to Heat Pump mode.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_7_1
parameter.label: 7: Thermostat Swing Temp
parameter.description: Temperature spread between the on and off temperatures<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe thermostat swing temperature is in units of 0.5 degrees Fahrenheit.</p&gt <p&gtA value of 0x01 is 0.5F and 0x02 is 1.0F.</p&gt <p&gtThe supported values may vary from thermostat to thermostat but typically the allowed values are 0.5F (0x01) to 4.0F (0x08).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_8_1
parameter.label: 8: Thermostat Diff Temp
parameter.description: How far off from target temp before turning on unit<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe thermostat differential temperature is in units of 0.5 degrees</p&gt <p&gtFahrenheit. A value of 0x04 is 2.0F and 0x06 is 3.0F. The differential</p&gt <p&gttemperature must be an integer value. Non-integer values, such</p&gt <p&gtas 1.5F (0x03), should not be used. The supported values may vary</p&gt <p&gtfrom thermostat to thermostat but typically, the allowed values are</p&gt <p&gt2.0F (0x04) to 6.0F (0x0C).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_9_1
parameter.label: 9: Thermostat Recovery Mode
parameter.description: Bring a space back to a normal occupied temp<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThe Thermostat Recovery Mode can be either fast (0x01) or</p&gt <p&gteconomy (0x02).</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_11_1
parameter.label: 11: Simple UI Mode
parameter.description: Toggle Simple UI Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf set to 0, Simple UI mode is disabled. If set to 1, Simple UI mode</p&gt <p&gtis enabled.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_12_1
parameter.label: 12: Multicast
parameter.description: Toggle Multicast Mode<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtIf set to 0, Multicast is disabled. If set to 1, Multicast is enabled.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_13_1
parameter.label: 13: Main Display Selection
parameter.description: Control which info is displayed in the main display area<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis configuration Param on the CT110 sets what information is displayed in the main thermostat display area (the largest central numbers on the display). The default values is to display the Temperature (0x01) on the main numbers.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_14_1
parameter.label: 14: Save Energy Mode Type
parameter.description: Save Energy Mode behavior<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis configuration value is used to read/write what behavior Save Energy Mode causes in the thermostat when the thermostat enters Save Energy Mode.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_15_1
parameter.label: 15: Fan Timer
parameter.description: Activate Fan w/ auto shutoff timer<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis configuration is used to activate the fan with an automatic shut-off timer.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_17_1
parameter.label: 17: Temperature Calibration
parameter.description: Temperature Calibration / Offset<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis configuration is used to set the temperature offset of the thermostat. The valid values are from -6 to 6. Note: although the thermostat UI can set calibrations in intervals of 0.5°F, this parameter can only accept whole numbers.</p&gt</p&gt

parameter.name: config_18_1
parameter.label: 18: Display Units
parameter.description: Celsius or Fahrenheit<br /&gt<h1&gtOverview</h1&gt<p&gt<p&gtThis configuration is used to set units used by the device to display temperature.</p&gt</p&gt
